SEARCH
Package com.rikuthin.data

Class EnemyRepository

java.lang.Object
com.rikuthin.data.EnemyRepository
public class EnemyRepository extends Object
Implements the **Repository pattern** as a singleton, providing centralized storage and controlled access for all currently active Enemy objects in the game world.

This class serves as the single source of truth for the game's active enemy population. It protects the integrity of the collection by exposing a read-only view via getEnemies() and requiring explicit mutation methods (like addEnemy(Enemy) and removeIf(Predicate)) for modification.

    • getInstance

      public static EnemyRepository getInstance()
      Retrieves the singleton instance of the EnemyRepository.
      Returns:
      The EnemyRepository instance.

    • getEnemies

      public Set<Enemy> getEnemies()
      /** Returns an unmodifiable/read-only view of the stored Enemy objects.

      Modifications must be done via the repository's explicit mutation methods (e.g., addEnemy, removeIf).

      Returns:
      The active enemies.

    • addEnemy

      public void addEnemy(Enemy enemy)
      Adds a new Enemy instance to the repository's collection of active enemies.

      The enemy is added only if the provided argument is not null.

      Parameters:
      enemy - The new Enemy instance to store.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the GameManager is not in the required RUNNING state.

    • removeEnemy

      public boolean removeEnemy(Enemy enemy)
      Removes a specific Enemy instance from the repository.
      Parameters:
      enemy - The enemy to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the enemy was present and successfully removed, false otherwise.

    • removeIf

      public int removeIf(Predicate<Enemy> filter)
      Removes any Enemy objects from storage which meet the given filter's requirements.
      Parameters:
      filter - A boolean-valued function which serves as a filter.
      Returns:
      The number of enemies removed.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all stored enemies from the repository.

      public int countEnemies()
      Counts the number of stored Enemy objects.
      Returns:
      The no. enemies stored.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether the repository is empty (has no elements).
      Returns:
      true if there are no elements; otherwise false.
